intro: Conohoria regnellii, commonly known as the regnellii conohoria, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and pinnate leaves that are typically green and somewhat leathery in texture. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with both male and female flowers, indicating its monoecious reproductive system. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
